get_content() get_contentSimplePie_Item SimplePie_Itemget_content
get_content ( $content_only = false )
Get the content for the item
Prefers full content over summaries, but will return a summary if full content does not exist.
To prefer summaries instead, use {Voir également
get_description}
Uses <atom:content> or <content:encoded> (RSS 1.0 Content Module)
Depuis
1.0
Paramètres
boolean$content_only
Should we avoid falling back to the description?
Renvoie
string|null

get_date ( $date_format = 'j F Y , g:i a' )
Get the posting date/time for the item
Uses <atom:published>, <atom:updated>, <atom:issued>, <atom:modified>, <pubDate> or <dc:date>
Note: obeys PHP's timezone setting. To get a UTC date/time, use {Voir également
get_gmdate}
Depuis

Paramètres
string$date_format

http://php.net/date} (empty for the raw data)

get_enclosure() get_enclosureSimplePie_Item SimplePie_Itemget_enclosure
get_enclosure ( $key = 0 , $prefer = null )
Get an enclosure from the item
Supports the <enclosure> RSS tag, as well as Media RSS and iTunes RSS.
Depuis
Beta 2
A faire
Add ability to prefer one type of content over another (in a media group).
Paramètres
int$key
The enclosure that you want to return. Remember that arrays begin with 0, not 1
Renvoie
SimplePie_Enclosure|null
Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
get_enclosures() get_enclosuresSimplePie_Item SimplePie_Itemget_enclosures
get_enclosures ( )
Get all available enclosures (podcasts, etc.)
Supports the <enclosure> RSS tag, as well as Media RSS and iTunes RSS.
At this point, we're pretty much assuming that all enclosures for an item are the same content. Anything else is too complicated to properly support.
Depuis
Beta 2
A faire
Add support for end-user defined sorting of enclosures by type/handler (so we can prefer the faster-loading FLV over MP4).
If an element exists at a level, but its value is empty, we should fall back to the value from the parent (if it exists). Renvoie
SimplePie_Enclosure[]|null List of SimplePie_Enclosure items

get_id() get_idSimplePie_Item SimplePie_Itemget_id
get_id ( $hash = false , $fn = 'md5' )
Get the unique identifier for the item
This is usually used when writing code to check for new items in a feed.
Uses <atom:id>, <guid>, <dc:identifier> or the about attribute for RDF. If none of these are supplied (or $hash is true), creates an MD5 hash based on the permalink, title and content.
Depuis
Beta 2
Paramètres
boolean$hash
Should we force using a hash instead of the supplied ID?
string | false$fn
User-supplied function to generate an hash
Renvoie
string|null
Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
get_item_tags() get_item_tagsSimplePie_Item SimplePie_Itemget_item_tags
get_item_tags ( $namespace, $tag)
Get data for an item-level element
This method allows you to get access to ANY element/attribute that is a sub-element of the item/entry tag.
See {Voir également
SimplePie::get_feed_tags()} for a description of the return value
Depuis
1.0
Voir également
http://simplepie.org/wiki/faq/supported_xml_namespaces
Paramètres
string$namespace
The URL of the XML namespace of the elements you're trying to access
string$tag
Tag name
Renvoie
array
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :

Get the latitude coordinates for the item
Compatible with the W3C WGS84 Basic Geo and GeoRSS specifications
Uses <geo:lat> or <georss:point>

get_local_date() get_local_dateSimplePie_Item SimplePie_Itemget_local_date
get_local_date ( $date_format = '%c' )
Get the localized posting date/time for the item
Returns the date formatted in the localized language. To display in languages other than the server's default, you need to change the locale with setlocale(). The available localizations depend on which ones are installed on your web server.
Depuis
1.0
Paramètres
string$date_format
Supports any PHP date format from {
Voir également
http://php.net/strftime} (empty for the raw data)
Renvoie
int|string|null
